intro: Gonzalagunia asperula, commonly known as the roughleaf gonzalagunia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, ovate leaves and showy, yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. It typically grows in wetlands and along stream banks, preferring moist, sandy soils. Gonzalagunia asperula is often found in swampy areas and is adapted to periodic flooding.
